topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: ACS Examples

body.p: The following figures show examples of the effect of applying ACS checks to TLPs on DSP and USP.

section.title: Examples of DSP ACS Handling Mechanisms
section.p: ACS checks examples for DSP are listed in below table.

ul.li: Bus Number from the Requester ID in upstream request is outside the DSP aperture
ACS violation is reported.
Address Translation (AT) field in Upstream Memory Request is not default value(0)
ACS violation is reported.
Peer-to-peer Completions received by the DSP do not have the Relaxed Ordering Attribute bit set (1b) Actions
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC.
DSP receives the upstream request or completion targeting to its egress port
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC.
DSP receives peer-to-peer Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the peer Egress Port.
The DSP receives Peer-to-Peer Requests
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC
Egress Control Vector Bit for the associated DSP is set
ACS violation is reported.
ACS T and ACS R are both enabled in DSP.
DSP receives Peer-to-Peer Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
ACS T has higher priority than ACS R.
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the peer Egress Port instead of being routed to RC.
ACS E and ACS R are both enabled in DSP.
Egress Control Vector Bit for the associated DSP is set.
DSP receives Peer-to-Peer Memory Requests
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC instead of being reported as ACS violation
ACS T and ACS E are both enabled in DSP
Egress Control Vector Bit for the associated DSP is set.
DSP receives Peer-to-Peer Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
ACS T has higher priority than ACS E.
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the peer Egress Port instead of being reported as ACS violation.
ACS T, ACS E and ACE R are enabled in DSP
Egress Control Vector Bit for the associated DSP is set.
DSP receives Peer-to-Peer Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
ACS T has higher priority than ACS E and ACS R.
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the peer Egress Port instead of being reported as ACS violation or being routed to RC.

section.title: Examples of USP ACS Handling Mechanisms
section.p: USP ACS checks are only applied when USP is associated with Management EP, the examples are listed in below table.

ul.li: USP secondary interface receives Memory Requests targeting vEP
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC
USP secondary interface receives Completions targeting vEP
The offending TLPs are redirected Upstream towards the RC
USP receives Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
The received Memory Requests are targeted to vEP.
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the vEP.
ACS T and ACS R are both enabled in USP.
SP receives Memory Requests whose Address Type (AT) field indicates a Translated address
The received Memory Requests are targeted to vEP.
The offending TLPs are routed normally ("directly") to the vEP instead of being routed to RC.
